titleStmt.title: Musik til Holger Drachmanns melodrama "Hr. Oluf han rider–"

work.title: Musik til Holger Drachmanns melodrama "Hr. Oluf han rider–"
Music for Holger Drachmann's Melodrama 'Sir Oluf He Rides–'
Den danske sommernats drama i fire akter og et forspil
A Danish Summer-Night's Drama in Four Acts and a Prelude

history.p: Holger Drachmann asked The Royal Theatre whether they would be interested in staging the play Hr. Oluf han rider– on the occasion of his 60th birthday. In May 1906, Carl Nielsen accepted the commission to compose the music, but the text needed to be revised before Nielsen could start working on the project. He began with the orchestral Prelude, and when the revised text arrived he worked during July and August with help from his friend Julius Röntgen on finishing the music. The rehearsals began in September.

event.desc: Palæ-Koncert. Prelude (Forspil) to the entire piece, Prelude (Forspil) to Act One, Prelude (Forspil) to Act Two and Dance (Dans) only.

role.name: Den gamle Kvinde ude i Skoven
The Old Woman in the Forest

incipText.p: Ud og ind og ind og ud
Snart paa Loft og snart i Kælder
O, hvilken Duft, naar Solen gaar ned
Hr. Oluf, der bredes Dig Dug paa Disk

expression.title: Fjerde Akt / Hanen gol og Hornet klang
Act Four / The Cock Has Crowed and the Horn Has Sounded

incipText.p: Saa kaster jeg mig for den Gamle paa Knæ
Søvn har jeg kastet paa ham og hende
